website_summaries.verdict: One of the best pairs of general-use and tactical gloves you can buy for added joint protection.
pros: Large padding along the knuckles and fingers does a good job of protecting the joints from minor impacts
Index and thumb linings have extra rubber for better grip while shooting
cons: Finger padding is too thick for some activities requiring more dexterity and control

website_summaries.verdict: The best work gloves on the market. A great choice for almost any work function or environment.
pros: Off the charts in terms of the padding, and grip
Offer unparalleled protection on knuckles and fingers
cons: May yield an unpleasant smell if they collect too much sweat

customer_reviews.title: Fake, knock off gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are not the real mechanix gloves that they described. The gloves that I got were fake knock off's and were falling apart in the first hour that I was wearing them as you can see in the pictures. At a closer look at the gloves they don't say Mechanix on the velcro, they actually say Mechamix. Also on the knuckle part of the gloves wear there supposed to say Impact, they actually say Mpact. I would not buy anything from the people who sold these. I am very disappointed that people are actually selling these to people.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: IT IS A DİSAPPOINTMENT!
customer_reviews.text: It is a disapointment! 2 years ago i have bought a pair of these gloves from military px in kaiser slautern Germany they were awesome they were genuine leather.I still use them. I though that they gonna be same but when i open the package see that my new gloves are replica they arent genuine leather. I have trust amazon's quality because there are lots of replicas on chinese sites and half price but, i got a replica gloves with double price. I dont know what can i do but i highly recomend that dont pay anything for this
customer_reviews.author: Turker

customer_reviews.title: not for small hands
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this brand. Their products are not women or small hand friendly. The only gloves that they make that will fit women or small hands are pink, girly and for gardening. So if someone with small hands wants to do mechanical or tactical work Mechanix will not help them by providing the gear they need. People with small hands should stick to gardening and other delicate activities. Got it, Mechanix. Message heard loud and clear. Next time be more inclusive and make gloves sizes for everyone. Get with the program and be inclusive.
customer_reviews.author: Honglu

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold up well-holes formed in fingers within 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with my purchase. My husband wore these for 2 weeks, using wire cutters at work, before holes formed in the fingers. I do not recommend wasting your money on these. I feel like I was fooled into doing just that.
customer_reviews.author: donna yates

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and affective
customer_reviews.text: Do you want to protect and strengthen your hands while: Performing Manual labor? Shooting your firearm? Using your cell phone in harsh conditions? These are the gloves for you! I use these while shooting, and can easily transition into cell phone use, moving heavy and jagged material, and probably my favorite thing is the knuckle protection should you have to handle someone in a security or law enforcement physical encounter. Two thumbs up on these bad boys! P.s. Only reason I gave 4/5 on the touchscreen is because no glove in my experience is very efficient in touch screen usage. It will work, but you may have to double up on some swipe or taps. Nothing ridiculous though.
customer_reviews.author: Tory Lord

customer_reviews.title: Not the high quality they market the gloves to be
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. Thread could be a much better quality. Used for a little over a month and have holes already. Heres the real kicker.....1. I dont do labor intensive work to warrant threading coming apart. Unless holding a palm sander (for sanding furniture) somehow is so life threatening for gloves. 2. I always go a size up to avoid that tight feeling and potentially ripping and tearing at the seams. Very disappointed and 4 days outside of the 30 day return. 😣
customer_reviews.author: AlphaSun

customer_reviews.title: These gloves reek of an overpowering chemical odor that does not go away.
customer_reviews.text: These are close to being the perfect work glove. But I don’t understand what causes the overpowering stench of these gloves. When I opened the package, it was ridiculously strong. I figured “They’re work gloves. Who cares about the odor? It will go away with use.” So far, that is not the case. The Velcro strap seems a tad short, and the edge of the glove curls up and gets in the way of the Velcro strap. This is not a huge issue, but one that could be improved. The fit is good and touch screen works pretty well when they are new.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The seams rip
customer_reviews.text: Look nice, but aren't really made for anything other than holding a rifle. I bought these for moving styrofoam boxes, and after the 1st week, the seam on the palm by my thumb came apart. Getting a 2nd pair sent, we'll see how those go.
customer_reviews.author: Stumpy

customer_reviews.title: Not up to par with the branding and ripped finger tips
customer_reviews.text: Bought these based on reviews hoping that it would last me and would be a good investment because of the name brand. To my surprise, they Ended up ripping at the fingers with generally wear and tear and wasn’t even misused in any way. Nothing cut it just from hardworking hands and they ripped. I would suggest getting a different glove if you plan on working which deals with a lot finger use and not just general lifting objects.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin T.

customer_reviews.title: Bad sizing
customer_reviews.text: I went to their website and measured myself as a medium women's, small men's size. I assumed this glove was for men and bought a small but it still doesn't fit well. It's way too long in the fingers and isn't fit for what I need- a bit more grip to do detailed work with. The material looks nice but unfortunately can't use it since it doesn't fit, and they don't offer a smaller size. Don't recommend buying from Amazon, don't trust the sizing at all.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: Cheap fake gloves!!! Don't buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the gloves doesn't even look like the pictures on the advertising. I put them on and the material is cheap, the size is wrong (buy Large) it does not fit at all. Long finger, small palm. I didn't even bother to use them. I been using Mechanix Wear for arround 10yrs now, I buy this on Amazon just for the Prime option, is not worth it. I'm returning them. I attached pictures of the last gloves that I've been using (High abrasion, Original, MPact) so you can see the difference, what is a really Original and was is cheap fake rip off gloves (black one)
customer_reviews.author: Javier Guifarro

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves.
customer_reviews.text: These are my new go-to work gloves. They last me about 3 months of daily use in the summers. They're not quite winter material, but I can definitely tell when the impact protections came in handy to reduce damage to my hands when I've had my clumsy moments. Dexterity isn't lost, and I don't find myself needing to pull these guys off often at all. I purchased a L set. I have 3-3.5 inch fingers, and 8 inches from middle finger tip, to the seam in my wrist. They fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Eric R. Shaver

customer_reviews.title: Great Motorcycle Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are great motorcycle gloves. Very comfortable and well reinforced on the knuckles and palms where it's most needed in the event of a fall. They are breathable enough for me in my cool climate, but might be a bit hot for those down south in the summer. And when the temps get even cooler, I wear a pair of Kevlar liner gloves under them for additional warmth and protection. A good buy for motorcyclists on a budget, and for those who, like me, do not want to wear leather.
customer_reviews.author: MBK

customer_reviews.title: Stiff at first, but accurate
customer_reviews.text: Is a bit stiff, so they do have a break in period. However right off the bat, I used my index finger to type a message to my friend and snapp these photos. Nimble enough to control and type with. I look foreward to shooting with these and updating this review. I say comfort not what I was hoping around the webbing of my finger. -1 star however, after a few minutes my fingers started getting sore. If they break in and feel good and dont hurt my Proximal Phalanx (one of the pinky bones) I'm willing to re-consider.
customer_reviews.author: Agent K

customer_reviews.title: Those gloves can be used for anything
customer_reviews.text: I ordered those gloves for physical training. They came in on time and got as expected. I used them for physical training. I also used them to change tires in vehicles as well. They can be used really for anything you wish to use them for. I could also use my touchscreen phone while wearing those gloves. I’d highly recommend anyone to buy those.
customer_reviews.author: Gershon Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Good for hurricane shutter installation right before a storm
customer_reviews.text: I only do work around the house, but during last hurricane season I helped my neighbors put up their shutters, and these gloves were excellent for this purpose. The shutters are aluminum, and can get hot in the FL sun, but these babies were an excellent thermal barrier. The shutters sometimes have sharp edges, but these guys protected my hands the entire time. Admittedly, I was not doing anything tactical with them, but what I asked of them they did well. Dexterity was not great, but I was looking for protection so it was a trade-off I was wiling to accept.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A decent glove, but runs small for the size.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a glove for shooting. These had pretty decent reviews, so opted for a pair. Chose the gray color. Product arrived, packaged in the usual Amazon packet, no damage. Normally I wear an Xlarge in gloves. So I ordered the XLarge. I probably should have ordered the next size up, as their sizes seem to run a bit small, and these are pretty snug for the fit. I've decided to keep them, as I feel they will stretch a bit over time. As I'll use them mainly for shooting, I would much rather have a glove that is a touch tight, than a glove that is too loose. Overall, I am pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A.

customer_reviews.title: Stitching came undone
customer_reviews.text: The stitching on the wrist strap on one of these gloves, came completely undone all by itself, making it impossible to cinch down the strap around your wrist, since the velcro separated from the strap. I use these as emergency gloves only and had only worn these 2 times and very briefly at that. I would not purchase this glove again. I'm very disappointed at the manufacturer's claim that these are heavy duty and durable gloves!
customer_reviews.author: Kit Kat

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought these were extremely expensive for work gloves, but after reading the reviews figured I'd try them. These things have held up great against a ton of abuse I've put them through wrenching on cars. No rips or holes and the padding is holding up wonderfully and is strategically placed. Very comfortable and the touch screen works great. The loop on the end to help get them on is a nice touch and underrated, makes getting them on so much faster without pulling at the ends of the gloves. Definitely worth buying as it seems they will last much longer than the cheap ones.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Supple, comfortable work gloves
customer_reviews.text: Bought these primarily for shooting but honestly considering a second pair for working on the motorcycle and light yardwork. They're extremely comfortable, the padded portions along the knuckles and back work well in right corners, and I felt the cut fit my hand well enough. The fingers were a little short but given time it'll break in. The key to any good glove is to wear it for 24 hours all day and let it mold to your hand. Unless something is WAY OFF it should make it fit like... Well, a glove.
customer_reviews.author: WhatsThatNoise

customer_reviews.title: Love these gloves! Great for Bee Keeping!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered my second pair. I mainly use these gloves for tending to my honey bees. This past Sunday, I was stung on the gloves over 40 times. I was widening the entry way on the hive and the bees got spooked. I received ZERO stings except on the gloves. I also use these for general work around the house. Very comfortable and easy to manipulate when wearing. I highly recomend these for just about anything but, I have to endorse for Bee keeping for sure!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: Strong smell out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Due to the type of rubber used, these gloves have a pretty strong smell that takes a long time to wear off. But oh boy, once it finally does...these gloves are REALLY nice, rugged just like I needed them to be. I wear them for geology work and I've scrambled across a volcano covered in pumice--they held up great and protected my hands like a boss. I want to get a backup pair, I just don't look forward to having to set them aside for a few months until they air out enough to where I can stand being in the same room with them.
customer_reviews.author: Geologick

customer_reviews.title: The best mountain biking gloves
customer_reviews.text: I use these for DH MTB along with dirt jumping / enduro riding. They are WAY better than any mtb specific glove I've found due to the extra padding over the knuckles and under the palms. I took a crash the other day that involved my hand hitting a rock slab and I just got a bad wrist sprain vs potentially breaking a bone in my hand and having a bad cut had I been wearing normal mountain biking gloves without the padding protecting your palms. They are also cheaper and last longer than MTB specific gloves so that's a bonus too.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: FAKES! DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: FAKE! THESE ARE FAKE KNOCK OFFS. See my pic, the top pair are the fakes and the bottom pair is the pair I just got directly from Mechanix.com. The fakes have rips, holes and stitching coming out in them and all I do is handle smooth auto glass. No rough surfaces. Only lasted about 5 to 6 months. Hopefully the real ones last longer.
customer_reviews.author: CRiSPY

customer_reviews.title: These are the best I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I had an older pair like these a long time ago, and I remembered loving them. I've tried a bunch of other brands since then, but have never been able to find a pair that holds up for more than a month. So I got on here looking for something similar to the ones I had before. And here we are. These hold up to whatever I throw at them. And keep my hands from getting cut up. Add a pair of nitrile gloves underneath, and you're protected from exposure as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Shackelton

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I was Looking For!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Ruger .454 Casull that kicks like a mule using 330 grain bear rounds, and it can really punish your hands. I bought these glovers to curb the impact, and they are awesome. You'll need to cut the fingertip on the trigger finger if you use them with a gun like the Casull that has a fairly small trigger well. They are fine as is for any rifle. My hands are pretty big, but the extra large worked well as they stretch some to give a snug controlling fit. I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Protected Knuckles
customer_reviews.text: I use these for motorcycle riding. I enjoy the protection from pebbles or small bugs but the rubber likely would not do too much against a heavier impact. They certainly are not cold weather gloves but do well for warmer temps as they like to breathe. The one negative I can say is that after long hours of wear I can see redness on pressure points on my hands after removing. Not enough that I can feel them so it doesn't bother me, they fade rather quickly.
customer_reviews.author: CCDOTS

customer_reviews.title: Fit is right in line with other Mechanix gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Mechanix would do well to create gloves that are specifically for male or female customers. Notice the difference in the lengths of my fingers and the fingers of the gloves. There is a great difference in the lengths. Unisex gloves do not fit men or women well. Men and women have distinctly different finger length proportions. With that said, these gloves fit very much like the other Mechanix gloves I have had. They are a bit tighter because they are stiffer due to the padding. If the finger lengths were more specific to a man's or woman's finger proportions, these would definitely be a 5 star product.
customer_reviews.author: NCC6462

customer_reviews.title: Legitness!
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of gloves! For being under 30$ these gloves have the look and feel of a 100$ pair. The XL fit my mitts pretty snug but it’s not uncomfortable at all. They’re not as breathable as I would like, but still a great product. The coyote brown matches all my other coyote color products perfectly. One of the big plus’ is that you can use your smartphone with these gloves! They touch your screen just like your bare fingers!
customer_reviews.author: TcJayLee

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting smell of chemicals.
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered several good pairs of these. Should have returned them, but ran out of time. They smelled disgusting like a combination of chemicals and urine and even after washing the smell wouldn't come out. Either these are counterfeit or extremely poor quality production run. They are trash. Very disappointed they changed so much from previous pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Winston Smith

customer_reviews.title: Never the same each buy
customer_reviews.text: I get something different every time I think I’m buying the same glove. Sometimes they come with a loop at the wrist, sometimes not. The most annoying change I found with the most recent pair I bought was the missing pad on the side of the index finger that used to provide great protection both shooting and just grabbing stuff in a hazardous environment. Don’t expect them to last forever if you are using them in a tactical environment, but they fit and feel great, can be washed, and have nice breathable extensor side so they are semi comfortable in the Mohave Desert in Summer.
customer_reviews.author: Epador

customer_reviews.title: Whats not to love?
customer_reviews.text: We all, already know about mechanix. Ive used these in very adverse conditions, cold, rain, wet, hot, and even used them for manual labor when I need them and they have held up well so far. I have large hands and the large gloves fit almost perfect, the thumb only being slightly too long. I tried on mechanix gloves at my local walmart to get an idea for fit first if thats an option for you. They do exactly what I expected them to do and they have held up fine, so I cant say much one way or the other. The grey matches 5.11 storm grey well if thats something that matters to you.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin D.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price! Military, motorcycles, camping... you name it!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are versatile and good enough quality for the price! They are not bullet-proof, but with enough care these gloves will last you a good amount of time and they do THE JOB! I purchased originally for camping purposes, but I got more use out of them in military training schools (SFQC). Granted... the stitching started coming undone, the elastic material around the wrist was stretching itself out, but I think its a testament that they lasted 6 weeks in the field. Also manageable during shooting drills/training. I liked them enough, that I purchased the black covert color for motorcycle riding! I only gave 4 stars because I think the stitching could be better! You won't regret these!
customer_reviews.author: Lemir

customer_reviews.title: Good tactical glove
customer_reviews.text: Good tactical glove. Provides a great thermal barrier within reason. I was stuck in the turret mount when the day started and it was 45, they kept my fingers warm enough. Later in the day it was 70 and they weren't hot. Moves and flexes without bunching or pulling. Velcro held really well. Only negative is that the tip of the trigger finger is just a little bulky so putting your finger into the trigger guard area isn't 100% smooth. But I would recommend and buy again if needed. Might just go with the next size down.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wear out way too quickly
customer_reviews.text: Received these gloves less than two weeks ago and a finger on the left right glove already has a hole. I would have expected, given a fairly limited amount of use, that a pair of $30+ gloves would have been considerably more durable. I am extremely disappointed with the quality of the M-Pact Coyote Tactical Glove. Although I have had other products from M-Pact, I would not recommend or buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: capt. i

customer_reviews.title: Great glove for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have been through dozens of gloves trying to find something that lets me write a citation, fire and reload comfortably but offers some sort of protection from cold as well. I've tried the pig full dexterity gloves, 5.11 and various others. These aren't perfect but they are the best I've found. Make sure to go to their website and find your hand size. The major cons for me, the little finger is to long and the material doesn't let me bunch it. The seam on the inside of the pointer fingers is too thick. It's annoying but for half the price and double the durability I'll take these over the other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Sean & Jen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me 6'6" 250#
customer_reviews.text: I apparently am a gorilla and don't fit anything xl anymore. Can't find gloves. These fit great in xxl and they last me a long time. Cannot recommend enough for big guys. May not be ideal of you got ham paws. They are narrow and long not big.
customer_reviews.author: Uri

customer_reviews.title: I like em..
customer_reviews.text: I have had mine for 2 years (using mainly as gloves for the range and hiking) with mild to medium abuse and they look great still. They flex nicely not hindering your finger joints and the padded knuckles feel like you could go 5 ufc rounds and be good still. Seriously, I feel like I can punch a hole through a concrete wall with these (do not try). I have them in size medium and to give a reference my hand measures 7 1/4 inches from the bottom of the heel of my hand to the end of my middle finger. Hope this helps, happy shootin!
customer_reviews.author: Edward Nigma

customer_reviews.title: who is a XL size and he was extremely happy to receive a great fitting glove
customer_reviews.text: Mechanics Wear has several models. The line over the M-Pact is a bit more money. However, These are in my EDC Bag and I use them for shooting gloves....and they work perfectly. They are true to size so get the correct size when you buy them. I have several pair of this model glove in different colors. I am a large in these gloves and I accidentally bought a pair in XL. They were too big and did not feel right. I gave the XL gloves to my son, who is a XL size and he was extremely happy to receive a great fitting glove.
customer_reviews.author: NICKy V

customer_reviews.title: Protect your hands!
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice quality gloves, they have a good fit and the added protection on the back of the hand is excellent so you don’t get your hands beat and bruised. Another bonus not mentioned is the use with touch screens, I’m currently writing this review on my phone while wearing the gloves. That is a huge plus in my book. They also look “tactical” as well. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Connor Croston

customer_reviews.title: Standing the test of time
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as a firefighter, specifically for truck work (picking up hose, running the pump, etc). These are a lifesaver. They’ve got extra protection at the knuckles, which is something I didn’t know I needed until I had it. True to size. It’s nice having gloves that fit properly. They’ve held up for about a year now, and I’ve definitely put them to the test. They take a while to dry, but I’ve not noticed any shrinkage. 10/10 will be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Single most uncomfortable glove I've ever bought
customer_reviews.text: After measuring that I'd need an XL size glove, I bought an XXL. I did so after reading many recommendations to buy one-up. I did so. Still, it's so tight that after three minutes my hands were both suffering fatigue -- JUST FROM WEARING. I'd send these back if I could. I'd PAY to send them back. But the best thing I can do is warn others. DO NOT BUY THIS GLOVE!
customer_reviews.author: gjsdb

customer_reviews.title: Do not last long
customer_reviews.text: First I left 5-star review here because these are supposed to be a very good gloves. After two months of normal usage they started to rip-off from each finger. This is how they look like after 6 months. If you are operating in a hot and dry climates I cannot recommend these. I do not know the reason why they didn't last (high temperatures?). Can I get money back or something?
customer_reviews.author: Lassi N.

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart.
customer_reviews.text: I have had good luck with these gloves before. I use them all the time. But this pair I just got has more lose threads and peeling padding than should be deemed acceptable. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little breaking in but they have saved my hands from abuse several times over. I've used these gloves to doing wood working, demolition or my basement walls, yard work and even for aircraft maintenance. They've been abused since I've bought them and are holding up fine. They've been soaked in jet fuel, aircraft hydraulic fluid, dust & dirt and besides being a little discolored they still work great.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and capable of the tasks at hand
customer_reviews.text: My wife gave these to me at Christmas after I had worn through another pair(not Mechanix) gloves. These are great and fit well, just remember to check your needed size with the hand chart they provide on their website. These are sturdy gloves without being restrictive and allow you to do things such as now the yard and do various chores while also being a capable glove for the range. They fit quite comfortably in the trigger housing of my AR15 as well my Springfield XD subcompact.
customer_reviews.author: Opforsoldier

customer_reviews.title: Good protection but at a price
customer_reviews.text: These lasted about 3 months of general use. With flatbed truck straps, just securing my load and tightening my straps with my bar. Very light use and they started to stitch out from the extra cloth on the pads then holes started to appear where they are no longer usable. Pros- Comfortable Durable to an extent Material is good with oils and liquids Cons- Stitching sucks Mpact is pretty pointless Dexterity isn’t good Going to try their leather mpact now....let’s see how it does
customer_reviews.author: Rebeltake

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy these, they are thick enough to get through some work (not extended periods) in the winter time with snow and below zero temps without your hands freezing. They feel pretty good and the velcro is holding up even after washes in the laundry. They do seem to have a pretty thick internal stitch right at the tip of the finger tips which can be annoying and with movement can rub your finger tip right by/under your fingernail.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kilroy

customer_reviews.title: The trigger finger needs to be cut off bc it does not have good dexterity. The thick fingers are also difficult to ...
customer_reviews.text: As tactical/shooting gloves, they're decent. I still prefer the PIG ALPHA gloves. These however provide plenty of protection. The trigger finger needs to be cut off bc it does not have good dexterity. The thick fingers are also difficult to get into the trigger guard even on a Glock. The stitching on the tips of the fingers cause you to put more finger than needed onto the trigger face. They do make a fingerless version of these so if you want to be able to shoot well and still have the mechanix protection, get those. If you want a full glove that is the best shooting glove in the known universe, get the PIG ALPHA.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Clinton Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: After trying another pair of gloves from Amazon that have some weird ridges on the knuckles I decided to try these. They are much more comfortable. The touch screen finger works great for using my GPS on my phone while riding my motorcycle. I was right in between a large and XL and I went up in order to have more flexibility in the gloves while riding.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Stoddard

customer_reviews.title: Wears out FAST
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of these gloves over a year ago and they were the most comfortable longest wearing pair of gloves that I ever owned. One year later they finally wore out. So I purchased another pair off of Amazon. I received them on March 9th 2020 and here it is April 12th 2020 and they are shot. Holes in nearly every finger and the palm protection area is falling off. I would rate the first pair of these gloves at 5 stars for everything but this second pair that I purchased doesn't even deserve a 1 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Alan M Harms

customer_reviews.title: This is a rugged pair of gloves, BUT!
customer_reviews.text: Love the gloves themselves but the velcro fastening is on the inside of the wrist not the back and it SUCKS! Hard to get the folds out of the material and hard to manipulate to fasten it closed. Also, the plastic on the backs stinks. It smells like you're holding a skunk. I've tried washing them but the smell just won't go away. I'm trying to find someone to give them to but the stink ruins the deal.
customer_reviews.author: Waldo Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Firewood gloves
customer_reviews.text: These were driving and shooting gloves which quickly turned into my firewood gloves once I used them to move around the logs in the fire. Resists the heat very well. I get looks from others when I reach into the fire, but now those people have gloves next to their fire pits as well. I do not endorse sticking your hands into a firepit. I do endorse not getting splinters though.
customer_reviews.author: GinoRP

customer_reviews.title: Best glove for mountain biking.
customer_reviews.text: These make all bike gloves obsolete. They are tear and impact resistant, and protect fingers from branches while cruising through a forest section. They are comfortable and breathable. I have a black full finger pair that I use in the summer. I bought these as gifts for my biking friends. All recipients love them.
customer_reviews.author: @RandomReality

customer_reviews.title: Stinks like GARLIC!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know wtf is up with these but THEY STINK LIKE GARLIC. I’m really bummed because they seem to be well made and are a decent comfortable fit. I aired them out in the sun for a couple days but they still STINK. Maybe Mechanix has moved their production facility to a Chinese location where they also make Asian food products???
customer_reviews.author: M. McCollum

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable--do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for airsoft/range shooting and they work alright. They have a major design flaw in the velcro straps being on the insides of the wrists, backwards from most gloves, so they cinch tight across the back of your hand but float and rub on the palm and it's difficult to get a good grip. They're decently protective and decently durable for what it's worth, but if you're doing anything longer than a LARP photoshoot you're just wasting your money. I guess I should have looked closer at them before I ordered, but I legitimately did not realize anyone was evil enough or retarded enough to make gloves this way. Steer clear of these.
customer_reviews.author: Avalon

customer_reviews.title: If you have to remove these gloves more then 3 times a day the velcro straps will fail.
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are perfet in almost every way except one. Velcro is garbage. After 30 days of uses the goves were still in great condition except the velcro rist straps didn't hold anymore and the velcro fell apart enough that the stiching was not holding it anymore. Great gloves though they don't stay on very well after the velcro craps out. It would be great if they made these gloves in the speed fit. The speed fit gloves I have are to thin and I wear holes in them in just a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: TheSquatch

customer_reviews.title: Great home repair gloves
customer_reviews.text: Bought these shortly after buying my first home at the suggestion of my father-in-law, and boy was he right! I’ve been getting so much use out of these, from the move to projects around the house. The one day I tried to go without them on a project I needed up with scratches and a few cuts, lesson learned. Would highly recommend, go a size smaller, they run big, especially in the fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Golden Badger

customer_reviews.title: Great for biking now with crash testing
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these gloves. I use them only for mountain biking and my first pair last over a year before the stitching started coming un-done but they remained useful. I have yet to test them but I think they will protect my hands in a fall. Padded knuckles is nice to as it the tacti-cool coyote color. The quality could be a little better and they could vent a little better but for the price currently they are a solid 4 stars ----update--- crash tested now the new gloves were fine in a crash I did manage to break my wrist but I didn't have a scratch on either hand. They also stayed on.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: really nice gloves. Mine appear to be the real deal
customer_reviews.text: Overall, really nice gloves. Mine appear to be the real deal, not fakes as some others have unfortunately received. They are comfortable gloves and appear of very good quality. Only complaints are the rubber on the knuckles does not offer much extra protection, the XLs are a little big in in some fingers and the velcro strap is under the inside of the hand, not on top of the wrist (opens when trying to reach in pocket).
customer_reviews.author: Perphektxero

customer_reviews.title: Genuine Mechanix Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Having become anxious reading the various reviews about blatant counterfeit gloves, I am pleased to confirm that the gloves I received are indeed genuine. Over the Labor Day holiday, I placed an order for (4) pairs of various gloves directly from Mechanix.com. The packaging, product-to-card retention method (i.e. zip tie), and details (e.g. perfectly symmetrical finger tip reinforcements & related stitching) are all identical to the gloves I received from the manufacturer directly. Great pricing and shipping speed as always!
customer_reviews.author: RLEE

customer_reviews.title: Good for now
customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing these glove for work now for a while and they are great. Comfortable, has a little cushion on the palms for impacts but for some reason this pair I had just bought had a home right on my index finger in the stitching. Most have had a few missed so hopefully this is one of few that is out there.
customer_reviews.author: Imlay

customer_reviews.title: My go to tactical glove.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are worth every penny, if you're looking for a well made comfortable tactical glove you won't be disappointed. With that said no two or should I say four hands are alike, so these may not have the same perfect fit for you as they do for me. At the very least though they're worth giving a try.
customer_reviews.author: ViaVeritas

customer_reviews.title: Once great, now pretty questionable
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loved the pair of these I bought a year ago. Decided to order another pair since they’ve been destroyed from lots of use. This new pair seems flimsy, overly bulky, and had a very different fit. It was almost like a knockoff. I had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Long Distance Hiker

customer_reviews.title: My favorite work gloves.
customer_reviews.text: These are great gloves and they are very comfortable. Sizing felt right - a lot of XXL gloves I tried were way too small but these actually fit my hands perfectly. I know they are 'tactical gun gloves' but these are my favorite pair of work gloves. I wish they had touch screen capacitors so I didn't have to remove the gloves to answer a phone call. That's my only complaint, other than that I really love them.
customer_reviews.author: Matty D

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Awesome - Cool design, Inexpensive, and it seems to WORK.
customer_reviews.text: Seems pretty sweet. Comfort - Top notch. Slight bit of roughness when I initially put the gloves on. That is completely disappeared, and the gloves fit great. Each finger fits right. I'm on the upper end of XL, right at the limit, bought a 2X, but was a little too big. Design - Great, with the exception of the Mechanix over and over again. Padding/Protection - Awesome, I feel completely protected. Value - These seems great, fit better than the Ironclad's I have stacked up beside them. They were like $20 bucks or something. Pretty dang awesome if you ask me. Weight - Seems pretty lightweight, not an expert. Not really an issue for me. I'm a grown up. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Apathetic

customer_reviews.title: Not a snug glove
customer_reviews.text: This is way too big for a small, not true to size
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Good for so many uses.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Mechanix gloves for years, and these do not disappoint. I actually have several pairs with less bulk to them for working on my car, but I got these due to all the extra padding. I own a S&W .460 Magnum, and I needed a shooting glove that had a little something extra in the palm. The problem with a handgun that large is obvious if you shoot more than 5rds, it starts to wear on your hand pretty bad. This glove feels good, and helps cushion the blow. If they can hold up to that hand canon, they should be GREAT for impact tools and the like.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it’s suppose to be for touchscreen. It does work for swiping but not as easy for touch functions. I will review this again after trying more but I didn’t expect it to operate for touchscreen. Overall they feel great. I gave a wall full power punch and felt nothing on knuckles. There’s lots of protection to the hands.
customer_reviews.author: HKOR

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and protect your hands well
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for shooting with. They were very comfortable to wear for an entire day in about 100 degree weather. My hands didnt get too sweaty and they definitely didnt get beat up while wearing these. Very comfortable and still retain a lot of dexterity for the amount of protection they provide. I was still able to load rounds into my mags, disassemble some parts of the rifle and everything while wearing these. Very nice gloves
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit and decent padding
customer_reviews.text: These work great protecting my hand from fire ants, sticks, rocks, and everything else that we had during our recent alert shooting drills. The temperature was warm for fall, but not hot - so will have to see how they do in the summer time. Fit is just right, and so far seem durable and quality made. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D. W. Spangler

customer_reviews.title: May want to order a bit smaller
customer_reviews.text: I first bought a large as that's my typical glove size. These were a little too big (my thumb didn't reach the tip of glove). I kept it around since I'm sure I could use it for other purposes. The medium size was perfect though. they're comfortable and I like the more subdued "mechanix" print which was why I went with these vs their other gloves
customer_reviews.author: T. Eddy

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for my application
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of the originals and they are very comfortable. These are an attempt to replace a pair of expensive motorcycle gloves that made my finger tips numb. Originals have boxy finger tips so the inside stitching doesn’t rub tips. Unfortunately this model has similar stitching to my expensive motorcycle gloves and cause similar numbness.
customer_reviews.author: BobSmi

customer_reviews.title: All black gloves
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Saves my knuckles from scapes and I love the protective rubber layer. Not bulky. Very easy to pick up small items with them. Works for multiple uses. I used them recently to remove my Xmas lights off my holly bushes-perfect. Would definitely recommend, even though they are somewhat pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Root Cause🌿

customer_reviews.title: Love Love Love these Gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three sets (two tan and one black) for my survival kit; took kit; and mountain bike bag. To break them in, I washed my hands while wearing them and let the gloves air dry to form fit my fingers. They feel great, don't impede movement or dexterity, work well with the cell phone, and have saved my skin a number of times during mountain bike adventures. The tan gloves have a certain smell--not unpleasant but noticeable--and they're not waterproof; but, they do everything I need them to do. If they were cheaper, I'd buy more!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I’m using these gloves for hard work in winter conditions and so far they are holding up but now I need another pair for my shooting sports. They don’t keep my hands warm at all in freezing temps but I love the ability to control my touchscreen devices without removing my gloves!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Great shooting gloves
customer_reviews.text: I only use these gloves for shooting and they're amazing. I don't feel any recoil and I know my hands are safe if my gun misfires. Mine are a medium and they're a snug fit. I actually saw these gloves in the movie The Expendables and that's what motivated me to buy these. So yes, they're great tactical gloves for shooting.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gladwin

customer_reviews.title: I really like the fit on my hand. Too early to know about how they wear.
customer_reviews.text: They fit my hand particularly well. As they say fits like a glove. I have a short pinky finger and between a large and extra-large hand. And I just like the way they feel and fit. I will find out how they wear long term.
customer_reviews.author: M Peterson

customer_reviews.title: The, Mechanix Wear 'Tactical'
customer_reviews.text: Hey sports fans. Purchased back in Nov. 2014, these are still in good shape today. Albeit, they don't get as much wear as another pair of Mechanix gloves I own. Personally, I don't find the need for extra padding useful for the odd jobs that I do. In a true tactical situation, I'm sure they work very well. However, they are affordable, and I'd still recommend them. Have a great day.
customer_reviews.author: MegaDave

customer_reviews.title: Smells like pure chems
customer_reviews.text: Smelled like pure cancer! Wouldn't put these on if you paid me. Straight from china and I have no clue what chems they made these with, but I would not want them on my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Matthias B.

customer_reviews.title: Love the gloves
customer_reviews.text: Love the gloves, however, durability is suffering recently. Stitching at thumb web to first finger had failed inside 3 months of light use. I believe the stitching pulled - free. Disappointed this time around. Last pair lasted beyond 2 seasons, with heavier use.
customer_reviews.author: K. Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Not durable enough
customer_reviews.text: Mechanics wear is a brand that I'm relatively familiar with. In 2015 I purchased a pair that lasted my military enlistment and then some. This pair I've had for three months, and there's already a hole in the thumb. The touch screen functionality works as advertised, the padding is great for protecting against bumps and impacts, and they are very comfortable to wear. I work as an armed guard right now and they don't impede my performance at all. However I cannot recommend a product that won't last.
customer_reviews.author: Jered L Dean

customer_reviews.title: Sizing chart seems off
customer_reviews.text: I went by the sizing chart provided at time of purchase and when I received the gloves they were extremely difficult to put on and take off. Once I get them on they seem to fit fine and function okay.
customer_reviews.author: Flying High

customer_reviews.title: Mine were not knock offs
customer_reviews.text: Great for work. The pair I received are definitely legit and work great. If you are working on machinery or vehicles in tight spaces then buy. They save your knuckles from losing skin. Good for dirtbiking as well.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Favorite summer motorcycle gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Wearing as motorcycle Gloves. My favorite part is the palm pads. I havent fallen (knock on wood) but id imagine when your palms hit first they feel like they have some good protection. It is foam so probably will tear up pretty good but they are going to do the job. They also stay cool enough on hot summer days. Probably suggest looking to some leather if using in cold riding. Overall great gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Ragz

customer_reviews.title: Great durability, protects hands, not water resistant in any way
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are awesome im a garbage laborer and i have long trash routes that last 7 hours and i pick up the sharpest and worst things that could abuse the gloves and they have such great durability. The finger tips gave out first breaking in that area after a full month and a half of abusing them so hard. The patting really protects your hands as well . My coworkers get hurt alot with the cheap rubber gloves but im chilling with these. Also these arent water resistant at all and are horrible if soaked
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Nathaniel Moreno

customer_reviews.title: My favorite gloves
customer_reviews.text: Have owned 3 pairs of this style of Mechanix gloves while in the National Guard. They made it through 2 weeks of wilderness firefighting like champs and 5 years of infantry/scout training. I love these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Chance Golden

customer_reviews.title: Great for DIY Mechanics
customer_reviews.text: When you first get the gloves, they'll be tight but they'll break in after a day of work with them. The rubber padding is a life saver for my knuckles (that alone is worth the price!) The "touch screen" index fingers work great when I need to use my phone to shoot a text or pull up a YouTube video. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: snaredrumma

customer_reviews.title: Good for moderate use.
customer_reviews.text: My husband has managed to go through two different pairs of these gloves at work. He works on commercial & residential generators and A/C units, so sharper metal is involved and he has cut though the palm of the gloves. Yes we probably need to find a much more heavy duty glove, but I was disappointed he still had such a large cut on his hand! Would be good for more around the house work.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica S.

customer_reviews.title: Very Flexible, Good Protection
customer_reviews.text: Well made and very flexible. The color is darker than shown in the picture, more of a camel color than desert tan. The picture gave me the impression that the thumb and index finger tips were flexible rubber like the knuckles but they are just very slight indentations in the leather that are colored dark. Tried to pick up small items like coins and some 9mm which you can if you do it right but they make other styles that are better suited if that's what you need. They are comfortable with no rough edges inside to rub a sore spot on your hand. Good protection.
customer_reviews.author: G Wade

customer_reviews.title: Exceptionally strong and comfortable gloves
customer_reviews.text: These really well made gloves stand up to mechanics work as well as home repair. I have been wearing them during a bath remodel which entails removal of ceramic tile. When broken, tile becomes really sharp. These gloves haven't frayed or ripped in any way. Others I've owned have. I they are also great at absorbing impact when using a hammer or prying. I would highly recommend these and intend on getting more in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: TGRRAG

customer_reviews.title: Solid gloves but not 5 star
customer_reviews.text: They are as described. A little uncomfortable with the hard impact-resistant top. They are also a little tight due to the material. If you're in between go up a size. We will see how they hold up but they do work on device screens.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Not a well made glove. Only lasted about 2 1/2 months.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with these gloves. The rubber on the top of the fingers and knuckles became unattached and hang loosely. The extra protection on the palms became unattached and curled up. The area between the index finger and thumb on the left hand has a hole because the stitching came loose. All of these things happened around the same time.
customer_reviews.author: rm blackwell

customer_reviews.title: I put them through hell and they came out laughing
customer_reviews.text: Truly amazing pair of gloves. I bought them in preparation for working a setup crew of an annual festival I help with. I worked the festival's setup crew for 7 days and was onsite working for over 100 hours. So I promise that I put these gloves through a true beating. My hands are more battered from the six hours on day 1 when I left these gloves in my luggage (I went straight onsite from the airport) than the following six 12-18 hour days when I was wearing these gloves. The best part yet is that these gloves are still as functional as the day I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H.

customer_reviews.title: Best work glove available today!
customer_reviews.text: I think that these may in fact be the best work glove available on the market today! I purchased them after reviewing the best gloves available on the market today. Time will tell - but I go though at least a dozen pair of gloves a year working weekends on my hobby ranch. If I can cut the blowouts in half I will be happy. These gloves are armored as well and provide extra knuckle and finger tip protection. I was impressed enough to dash out measure my wife’s hands and order a pair in the correct size for her!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Brighton

customer_reviews.title: Good Protection, Nice Fit
customer_reviews.text: I forgot to choose a size for these gloves, but the ones I received (small, I guess, as I have small hands) fit very nicely indeed. These offer good protection for work that might damage hands. I bought them for cool/cold weather shooting, but they would offer good protection for yard work or auto repair. The knuckle and fingers are protected by a flexible, rubbery covering. I have a different pair of Mechanix Wear gloves I bought 8 or more years ago, and they have been wondeful - still in very nice condition. But I needed something with a bit more protection, and these fit the bill. They're really good-looking, as well. Very sharp and snappy in appearance.
customer_reviews.author: gloworm

customer_reviews.title: More Often Than Not...
customer_reviews.text: ...you will be able to use your phone's touch features using this glove. I own an older (worn out) pair of these gloves and the padding on the palm is still good. I bought this new pair because the fingers on my older gloves were cut open on a few occasions (from landscaping and picking up debris).
customer_reviews.author: ANDRE

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent sizing
customer_reviews.text: Despite being nearly identical to the black gloves except for the velcro wrist they are completely different sizes despite both being larges. The tan one are huge on my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Mars Allred

customer_reviews.title: Another pair I love and trust
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Mechanix gloves for over a decade now, and have always loved the quality and fit. These are no different even though they are my first M-pact style pair. Granted I bought these specifically for range use, so they won't get as beat up as my Jeep/Off-road or RV repair sets - but that just means I'll enjoy them longer!
customer_reviews.author: HomeSweetRoam

customer_reviews.title: great fit and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Not really water resistant but these work great to keep your hands clean and protected while doing yard work, mowing, weed eating, burning tree limbs, etc. These gloves also have a pad across the palm area for extra protection. I like the tactical appearance and a perfect fit! Easy to put on and remove as well.
customer_reviews.author: dwhitman

product_meta.title: Mechanix Wear - M-Pact Coyote Tactical Gloves (Large, Brown)
product_meta.description: Size:Large| Color:BrownLaw enforcement and service members trust their hands with the Coyote M-Pact and its ability to protect in the field. Impact-absorbing Thermoplastic Rubber (TPR) is sonic welded to the glove and delivers flexible protection against common impact injuries and skin abrasions. The uniquely designed Impact Guard frees your index finger for smooth trigger guard entry and mobility. The dual-layer internal fingertip construction reinforces the thumb and index finger for improved abrasion resistance, while the embossed fingertip pattern improves feel and overall dexterity. D3O palm padding absorbs and dissipates high-impact energy through the palm when you’re fully engaged so you can maintain your focus.
feature_bullets: Made in the USA and Imported
Thermoplastic Rubber (TPR) knuckle guard and finger guards protect against impact.
Dual-layer internal fingertip reinforcement provides added durability.
D3O palm padding absorbs and dissipates high-impact energy through the palm.
Nylon web loop provides convenient storage.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars4,550 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
